remarks: Type . . . not traced. There is a sheet at M with the¹inscription 'Villarica, Pohl 3698' which might be part of¹the type material. (see Opera Bot. 129: 18. 1996)
doi:10.1600/036364420X16033962925268 The name was chosen because of the similarity of the leaves with those from some Acanthaceae species.

remarks: doi:10.1600/036364420X16033962925268 The specific epithet is from 'tenebrosa', a Latin word meaning 'of shade', in allusion to the place where the plant was discovered and to the dark color of the stem and leaf adaxial surfaces.
